greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n >= 1} 1/S(n)!, where S(n) is the Kempner number A002034.
comment: Computed using suggestions from _David W. Wilson_ posted to Sequence Fans mailing list (seqfan(AT)ext.jussieu.fr), May 30 2002
reference: I. Cojocaru, S. Cojocaru, First Constant of Smarandache, Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 7, No. 1-2-3, 1996, 116-118.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Smarandache Constants
formula: Sum_{n>=1} 1/S(n)!, where S(n) is the Kempner function A002034.
Sum_{n>=1} A038024(n)/n!, where A038024(n) = #{k: S(k) = n}. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Aug 21 2006
mathematica: f[n_] := DivisorSigma[0, n! ]; s = 1; Do[s = N[s + (f[n + 1] - f[n])/(n + 1)!, 100], {n, 1, 10^4}]; RealDigits[s][[1]]
results.author: Charles T. Le (charlestle(AT)yahoo.com)
ext: Edited by _Robert G. Wilson v_ and _Don Reble_, May 30 2002
